member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.By
member.summary: Provides a mechanism by which to find elements within a document.
member.remarks: It is possible to create your own locating mechanisms for finding documents. In order to do this,subclass this class and override the protected methods. However, it is expected that that all subclasses rely on the basic finding mechanisms provided through static methods of this class. An example of this can be found in OpenQA.Support.ByIdOrName

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.By.XPath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by an XPath query. When searching within a WebElement using xpath be aware that WebDriver follows standard conventions: a search prefixed with "//" will search the entire document, not just the children of this current node. Use ".//" to limit your search to the children of this WebElement.
member.param: The XPath query to use.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.By.ClassName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by their CSS class.
member.param: The CSS class to find.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.
member.remarks: If an element has many classes then this will match against each of them. For example if the value is "one two onone", then the following values for the className parameter will match: "one" and "two".

member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user can execute JavaScript.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IJavaScriptExecutor.ExecuteScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.param: The JavaScript code to execute.
The arguments to the script.
member.returns: The value returned by the script.

remarks.para: The method executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window. This means that "document" will refer to the current document. If the script has a return value, then the following steps will be taken:

item.description: For an HTML element, this method returns a
For a number, a is returned
For a boolean, a is returned
For all other cases a is returned.
For an array,we check the first element, and attempt to return a of that type, following the rules above. Nested lists are not supported.
If the value is null or there is no return value, is returned.

remarks.para: Arguments must be a number (which will be converted to a ), a , a or a . An exception will be thrown if the arguments do not meet these criteria. The arguments will be made available to the JavaScript via the "arguments" magic variable, as if the function were called via "Function.apply"

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IJavaScriptExecutor.ExecuteAsyncScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes JavaScript asynchronously in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.param: The JavaScript code to execute.
The arguments to the script.
member.returns: The value returned by the script.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.Back
member.summary: Move back a single entry in the browser's history.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.Forward
member.summary: Move a single "item" forward in the browser's history.
member.remarks: Does nothing if we are on the latest page viewed.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.GoToUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Load a new web page in the current browser window.
member.param: The URL to load. It is best to use a fully qualified URL
member.remarks: Calling the method will load a new web page in the current browser window. This is done using an HTTP GET operation, and the method will block until the load is complete. This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.GoToUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Load a new web page in the current browser window.
member.param: The URL to load.
member.remarks: Calling the method will load a new web page in the current browser window. This is done using an HTTP GET operation, and the method will block until the load is complete. This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.INavigation.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the current page.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user can define timeouts.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.ImplicitlyWait(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait.
member.returns: A self reference
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.SetScriptTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait. Setting this parameter to will allow the script to run indefinitely.
member.returns: A self reference

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.SetPageLoadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait. Setting this parameter to will allow the page to load indefinitely.
member.returns: A self reference

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.ImplicitWait
member.summary: Gets or sets the implicit wait timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.AsynchronousJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the asynchronous script timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously. This timeout only affects the method.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.ITimeouts.PageLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the page load timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user controls the browser.
member.remarks:
The interface is the main interface to use for testing, which represents an idealized web browser. The methods in this class fall into three categories:
Control of the browser itself
Selection of IWebElements
Debugging aids
Key properties and methods are , which is used to load a new web page by setting the property, and the various methods similar to , which is used to find IWebElements.
You use the interface by instantiate drivers that implement of this interface. You should write your tests against this interface so that you may "swap in" a more fully featured browser when there is a requirement for one.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Close
member.summary: Close the current window, quitting the browser if it is the last window currently open.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Quit
member.summary: Quits this driver, closing every associated window.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Manage
member.summary: Instructs the driver to change its settings.
member.returns: An object allowing the user to change the settings of the driver.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Navigate
member.summary: Instructs the driver to navigate the browser to another location.
member.returns: An object allowing the user to access the browser's history and to navigate to a given URL.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.SwitchTo
member.summary: Instructs the driver to send future commands to a different frame or window.
member.returns: An object which can be used to select a frame or window.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL the browser is currently displaying.
member.remarks: Setting the property will load a new web page in the current browser window. This is done using an HTTP GET operation, and the method will block until the load is complete. This will follow redirects issued either by the server or as a meta-redirect from within the returned HTML. Should a meta-redirect "rest" for any duration of time, it is best to wait until this timeout is over, since should the underlying page change while your test is executing the results of future calls against this interface will be against the freshly loaded page.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.Title
member.summary: Gets the title of the current browser window.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.PageSource
member.summary: Gets the source of the page last loaded by the browser.
member.remarks: If the page has been modified after loading (for example, by JavaScript) there is no guarantee that the returned text is that of the modified page. Please consult the documentation of the particular driver being used to determine whether the returned text reflects the current state of the page or the text last sent by the web server. The page source returned is a representation of the underlying DOM: do not expect it to be formatted or escaped in the same way as the response sent from the web server.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.CurrentWindowHandle
member.summary: Gets the current window handle, which is an opaque handle to this window that uniquely identifies it within this driver instance.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver.WindowHandles
member.summary: Gets the window handles of open browser windows.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user controls elements on the page.
member.remarks: The interface represents an HTML element. Generally, all interesting operations to do with interacting with a page will be performed through this interface.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Clear
member.summary: Clears the content of this element.
member.remarks: If this element is a text entry element, the method will clear the value. It has no effect on other elements. Text entry elements are defined as elements with INPUT or TEXTAREA tags.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.SendKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Simulates typing text into the element.
member.param: The text to type into the element.
member.remarks: The text to be typed may include special characters like arrow keys, backspaces, function keys, and so on. Valid special keys are defined in .
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not enabled.
Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits this element to the web server.
member.remarks: If this current element is a form, or an element within a form, then this will be submitted to the web server. If this causes the current page to change, then this method will block until the new page is loaded.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.

remarks.para: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined. behavior.
If this element is not clickable, then this operation is ignored. This allows you to simulate a users to accidentally missing the target when clicking.

member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.param: The name of the attribute.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element: Attribute nameValue returned if not explicitly specifiedValid element types
checkedcheckedCheck Box
selectedselectedOptions in Select elements
disableddisabledInput and other UI elements
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.TagName
member.summary: Gets the tag name of this element.
member.remarks: The property returns the tag name of the element, not the value of the name attribute. For example, it will return "input" for an element specified by the HTML markup <input name="foo" />.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Text
member.summary: Gets the innerText of this element, without any leading or trailing whitespace, and with other whitespace collapsed.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Enabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is enabled.
member.remarks: The property will generally return for everything except explicitly disabled input elements.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Selected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is selected.
member.remarks: This operation only applies to input elements such as checkboxes, options in a select element and radio buttons.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Location
member.summary: Gets a object containing the coordinates of the upper-left corner of this element relative to the upper-left corner of the page.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Size
member.summary: Gets a object containing the height and width of this element.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement.Displayed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is displayed.
member.remarks: The property avoids the problem of having to parse an element's "style" attribute to determine visibility of an element.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IWindow

member.remarks: When setting this property, it should act as the JavaScript window.resizeTo() method.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType
member.summary: Represents the known and supported Platforms that WebDriver runs on.
member.remarks: The class maps closely to the Operating System, but differs slightly, because this class is used to extract information such as program locations and line endings.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Any
member.summary: Any platform. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Windows
member.summary: Any version of Microsoft Windows. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.WinNT
member.summary: Any Windows NT-based version of Microsoft Windows. This value is never returned by a driver, but can be used to find drivers with certain capabilities. This value is equivalent to PlatformType.Windows.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.XP
member.summary: Versions of Microsoft Windows that are compatible with Windows XP.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Vista
member.summary: Versions of Microsoft Windows that are compatible with Windows Vista.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Mac
member.summary: Any version of the Macintosh OS

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Unix
member.summary: Any version of the Unix operating system.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Linux
member.summary: Any version of the Linux operating system.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.PlatformType.Android
member.summary: A version of the Android mobile operating system.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver.FindElement(OpenQA.Selenium.By)

member.summary: Finds the elements on the page by using the object and returns a ReadOnlyCollection of the Elements on the page
member.param: By mechanism to find the element
member.returns: ReadOnlyCollection of IWebElement

member.summary: Gets or sets the responsible for detecting sequences of keystrokes representing file paths and names.
member.remarks: The Chrome driver does not allow a file detector to be set, as the server component of the Chrome driver (ChromeDriver.exe) only allows uploads from the local computer environment. Attempting to set this property has no effect, but does not throw an exception. If you are attempting to run the Chrome driver remotely, use in conjunction with a standalone WebDriver server.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Clear
member.summary: Clears the content of this element.
member.remarks: If this element is a text entry element, the method will clear the value. It has no effect on other elements. Text entry elements are defined as elements with INPUT or TEXTAREA tags.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.SendKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Simulates typing text into the element.
member.param: The text to type into the element.
member.remarks: The text to be typed may include special characters like arrow keys, backspaces, function keys, and so on. Valid special keys are defined in .
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not enabled.
Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits this element to the web server.
member.remarks: If this current element is a form, or an element within a form, then this will be submitted to the web server. If this causes the current page to change, then this method will attempt to block until the new page is loaded.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.
member.remarks: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined behavior.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is not enabled.
Thrown when the target element is not visible.
Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.param: The name of the attribute.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element: Attribute nameValue returned if not explicitly specifiedValid element types
checkedcheckedCheck Box
selectedselectedOptions in Select elements
disableddisabledInput and other UI elements
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Selected

member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Size

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Displayed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this element is displayed.
member.remarks: The property avoids the problem of having to parse an element's "style" attribute to determine visibility of an element.
member.exception: Thrown when the target element is no longer valid in the document DOM.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.LocationOnScreenOnceScrolledIntoView
member.summary: Gets the point where the element would be when scrolled into view.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Coordinates
member.summary: Gets the coordinates identifying the location of this element using various frames of reference.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebElement.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of the element
member.remarks: This property is internal to the WebDriver instance, and is not intended to be used in your code. The element's ID has no meaning outside of internal WebDriver usage, so it would be improper to scope it as public. However, both subclasses of and the parent driver hosting the element have a need to access the internal element ID. Therefore, we have two properties returning the same value, one scoped as internal, the other as protected.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.Firefox.FirefoxDriver
member.summary: Provides a way to access Firefox to run tests.
member.remarks:
When the FirefoxDriver object has been instantiated the browser will load. The test can then navigate to the URL under test and start your test.
In the case of the FirefoxDriver, you can specify a named profile to be used, or you can let the driver create a temporary, anonymous profile. A custom extension allowing the driver to communicate to the browser will be installed into the profile.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Firefox.FirefoxProfile.AcceptUntrustedCertificates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Firefox should accept SSL certificates which have expired, signed by an unknown authority or are generally untrusted. Set to true by default.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Firefox.FirefoxProfile.AssumeUntrustedCertificateIssuer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Firefox assume untrusted SSL certificates come from an untrusted issuer or are self-signed. Set to true by default.

remarks.para: Due to limitations within Firefox, it is easy to find out if a certificate has expired or does not match the host it was served for, but hard to find out if the issuer of the certificate is untrusted. By default, it is assumed that the certificates were not issued from a trusted certificate authority.

If you receive an "untrusted site" prompt it Firefox when using a certificate that was issued by valid issuer, but the certificate has expired or is being served served for a different host (e.g. production certificate served in a testing environment) set this to false.

member.remarks: When the WebDriver object has been instantiated the browser will load. The test can then navigate to the URL under test and start your test.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerDriver.FileDetector
member.summary: Gets or sets the responsible for detecting sequences of keystrokes representing file paths and names.
member.remarks: The IE driver does not allow a file detector to be set, as the server component of the IE driver (IEDriverServer.exe) only allows uploads from the local computer environment. Attempting to set this property has no effect, but does not throw an exception. If you are attempting to run the IE driver remotely, use in conjunction with a standalone WebDriver server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the path to which the supporting library of the IEDriverServer.exe is extracted. Defaults to the temp directory if this property is not set.
member.remarks: The IEDriverServer.exe requires extraction of a supporting library to perform some of its functions. Setting This library is extracted to the temp directory if this property is not set. If the property is set, it must be set to a valid directory.

member.summary: Indicates the behavior is not set.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerPageLoadStrategy.Normal
member.summary: Waits for pages to load and ready state to be 'complete'.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerPageLoadStrategy.Eager
member.summary: Waits for pages to load and for ready state to be 'interactive' or 'complete'.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerPageLoadStrategy.None
member.summary: Does not wait for pages to load, returning immediately.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions
member.summary: Class to manage options specific to

example.code: InternetExplorerOptions options = new InternetExplorerOptions(); options.IntroduceInstabilityByIgnoringProtectedModeSettings = true;
InternetExplorerDriver driver = new InternetExplorerDriver(options);
RemoteWebDriver driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new Uri("http://localhost:4444/wd/hub"), options.ToCapabilities());

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore the zoom level of Internet Explorer .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use native events in interacting with elements.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.RequireWindowFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to require the browser window to have focus before interacting with elements.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.InitialBrowserUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial URL displayed when IE is launched. If not set, the browser launches with the internal startup page for the WebDriver server.
member.remarks: By setting the to and this property to a correct URL, you can launch IE in the Internet Protected Mode zone. This can be helpful to avoid the flakiness introduced by ignoring the Protected Mode settings. Nevertheless, setting Protected Mode zone settings to the same value in the IE configuration is the preferred method.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.ElementScrollBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for describing how elements are scrolled into view in the IE driver. Defaults to scrolling the element to the top of the viewport.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.UnexpectedAlertBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for describing how unexpected alerts are to be handled in the IE driver. Defaults to .

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.PageLoadStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for describing how the browser is to wait for pages to load in the IE driver. Defaults to .

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.EnablePersistentHover
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable persistently sending WM_MOUSEMOVE messages to the IE window during a mouse hover.

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time the driver will attempt to look for a newly launched instance of Internet Explorer.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.FileUploadDialogTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time the driver will attempt to look for the file selection dialog when attempting to upload a file.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force the use of the Windows CreateProcess API when launching Internet Explorer. The default value is .

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.IE.InternetExplorerOptions.ForceShellWindowsApi
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force the use of the Windows ShellWindows API when attaching to Internet Explorer. The default value is .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clear the Internet Explorer cache before launching the browser. When set to , clears the system cache for all instances of Internet Explorer, even those already running when the driven instance is launched. Defaults to .

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.PhantomJS.PhantomJSDriver.ExecutePhantomJS(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a PhantomJS script fragment. Provides extra functionality not found in WebDriver but available in PhantomJS.
member.param: The fragment of PhantomJS JavaScript to execute.
List of arguments to pass to the function that the script is wrapped in. These can accessed in the script as 'arguments[0]', 'arguments[1]','arguments[2]', etc
member.returns: The result of the evaluation.

remarks.para: See the PhantomJS API for details on what is available.
A 'page' variable pointing to currently selected page is available for use. If there is no page yet, one is created.
When overriding any callbacks be sure to wrap in a try/catch block, as failures may cause future WebDriver calls to fail.

Certain callbacks are used by GhostDriver (the PhantomJS WebDriver implementation) already. Overriding these may cause the script to fail. It's a good idea to check for existing callbacks before overriding.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts
member.summary: Defines the interface through which the user can define timeouts.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.#ctor(OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class
member.param: The driver that is currently in use

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.ImplicitlyWait(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait.
member.returns: A self reference
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.SetScriptTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait. Setting this parameter to will allow the script to run indefinitely.
member.returns: A self reference

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.SetPageLoadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.
member.param: A structure defining the amount of time to wait. Setting this parameter to will allow the page to load indefinitely.
member.returns: A self reference

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.ImplicitWait
member.summary: Gets or sets the implicit wait timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for an element if it is not immediately present.
member.remarks:
When searching for a single element, the driver should poll the page until the element has been found, or this timeout expires before throwing a . When searching for multiple elements, the driver should poll the page until at least one element has been found or this timeout has expired.
Increasing the implicit wait timeout should be used judiciously as it will have an adverse effect on test run time, especially when used with slower location strategies like XPath.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.AsynchronousJavaScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the asynchronous script timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait when executing JavaScript asynchronously. This timeout only affects the method.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteTimeouts.PageLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the page load timeout, which is the amount of time the driver should wait for a page to load when setting the property.

member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable typesl; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Newtonsoft.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.
